description: How should domain concepts communicate with each other and external systems?
question: What is your default integration approach between components and systems?

options.name: Direct In-Process
options.description: Components communicate through direct method calls within the same process. Tight coupling, simple, synchronous.
options.when_to_use: Monolithic architecture, single deployment unit, strong consistency required, low latency critical
example: (All services in same process, immediate synchronous response)

options.name: Service/RPC Calls
options.description: Components communicate through remote procedure calls (REST, gRPC, SOAP). Request-response pattern over network.
options.when_to_use: Microservices, distributed systems, independent deployment, team autonomy
example: Validates inventory: Boolean, InventoryClient (REST call to /inventory/{sku})

options.name: Event-Driven/Messaging
options.description: Components communicate by publishing and subscribing to domain events. Asynchronous, loosely coupled.
options.when_to_use: Eventual consistency acceptable, scalability priority, decoupled evolution, audit trail needed
example: Reserves stock for order: Reservation, OrderPlaced event

options.name: Data/Shared Database
options.description: Components communicate through shared data store. One writes, others read. Polling or change detection.
options.when_to_use: Legacy integration, batch processing, reporting systems, data warehouse patterns
example: Saves to orders table: Order (writes to shared database)
Processes new orders: Order (reads pending orders)
Updates order status: OrderId, Status (writes back)

options.name: Hybrid Per Boundary
options.description: Different integration approaches for different boundaries. Direct within bounded context, events across contexts.
options.when_to_use: Complex systems, varying consistency requirements, mixed legacy and modern
example: Order calls PaymentGateway via REST API
